sentence.Network_en: The seven major industrial countries will have their yearly meeting in London.

sentence.Network_en: The functionalist model of industrial society was subjected to conceptual criticism.
sentence.Network_cn: 工业社会的实用主义模型在概念上遭到了批判。

sentence.Network_en: Its trade and industrial policies should be used more ambitiously.
sentence.Network_cn: 其贸易和工业政策的适用范围应该扩大。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from industry + -al; in later use influenced by French industriel

entry.def: You use industrial to describe things which relate to or are used in industry.

example.ex: ...a link between industrial chemicals and cancer.
example.tran: 化工制品与癌症的联系

entry.tran: 工业高度发达的;工业化的
entry.def: An industrial city or country is one in which industry is important or highly developed.

example.tran: 西方工业大国的部长们

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or resulting from industry;

sentences.sentence: "the industrial term in use among professional thieves"

means.word_mean: 5. suitable to stand up to hard wear;

destruct破坏+ive……的→adj.破坏性
industry工业, 产业+ial……的→industrial
industry勤奋+ious..的→industrious
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+ive表形容词→adj.有益的, 教育性的

obstruct[v.阻隔,阻塞[道路,通道等]n.阻碍物,障碍物]+ion表名词→n.妨碍,障碍物

de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏
destruct破坏+ion表名词→弄坏结构→破坏

stems_affixes.value_cn: 工业, 产业, 行业, 勤奋
stems_affixes.word_buile: indu=in+str=struct建立,结构+y→n.工业, 产业, 行业, 勤奋
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+ion表名词→n.教授;指导;[n.]用法说明[书],操作指南
instruct[v.教,教授;命令,指示]+or人→n.指导者,教员
in内+stru=struct建立,结构+ment物→内部构造→仪器,工具
instrumental[adj.仪器的;器械的;乐器的;起作用的;有帮助的]+ity性质→n.手段
ob反+struct建立,结构→反建设→阻塞,阻碍
struct建立,结构+ure表名词→n.结构,构造;建筑物 v.构造,建造

stems_affixes.value_cn: 基础,下部结构,地下建筑

super上面+structure结构→上面的结构→上层建筑
con共同+struct建立,结构→共同建立→建设,建造
de坏+stroy=struct建立,结构→v.破坏,摧毁,消灭
de去掉,变坏+struct建立,结构→adj.破坏的 n.故意或有计划的破坏 v.破坏
in进+struct建立,结构→把知识建立进去→指导,指示
ob反+struct建立,结构→反建设→阻塞,阻碍
re再+construct[v.建设,建造,构造;创立]→v.重建,再建;重现,再现
struct建立,结构+ure表名词→n.结构,构造;建筑物 v.构造,建造

Sentence.sentence: Industrial production fell by 12.8% in the year to March, the worst slide since the Second World War.
In fact, they are less significant, but steel-related manufacturing still accounts for 44% of industrial activity.
It remains a major part of industrial activity

Colleges, for their part, have since 1985 graduated fewer chemical, mechanical, industrial and metallurgical (冶金的) engineers, partly in response to the reduced role of manufacturing, a big employer of them.

It is important that we be mindful of the earth, the planet out of which we are born and by which we are nourished, guided, healed-the planet, however, which we have abused to a considerable degree in these past two centuries of industrial exploitation.

From self-service checkout lines at supermarket to industrial robots armed with saws and taught to carve up animal bodies in slaughter-houses, these ever-more-intelligent machines are now not just assisting workers but actually kicking them out of their jobs.
